nodes.bodyText:
We have to be careful with this change. This would fail if a DataMap is traversed in multiple threads concurrently. I'm sure there are apps that do concurrent traversals. This might even happen within the context of a single request also.
Also, this might happen more often in tests sharing a common test input and run in parallel.
I was thinking we should keep the existing algo, and provide a config for services to disable the cycle check (or use a count based check)

I updated the existing algo to use ThreadLocal to get around your concern. It will still be faster than using an identityset.
I also added an API to customize the cycle checker.
